comments:
I have a clean installation of eclipse 3.3M7. When I click on Window -> Preferences -> Java -> Installed JREs I get java.util.ConcurrentModificationException (full stacktrace below).

IMO this bug is reproducible with specific os configuration, as it only occurs on my WindowsXP installation at work, on another computer it works fine.

I looked into code of StandardVMType.getDefaultLibraryLocations() method and I think that problem is with using List.remove() method instead of ListIterator.remove() method in line 321.

Here's the full stacktrace:

Created an attachment (id=66686)
patch

it seems that in our code we already use a listIterator, but in the iteration code we were calling List.remove instead of ListIterator.remove.
Darin, please review and apply patch
*** Bug 188713 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
